Include humoral and cellular responses of host

On further examination, His mother had developed painful vesicular lesions on her genitalia several days prior to the birth of her son. She had not got it treated until she was in heavy labor. At admission to labor and delivery, internal lesions were seen on her cervix and vaginal walls, but the birth was imminent. questions.correct_answer: B. Direct immunofluorescence for HSV on cells from lesions

questions.text: A patient being treated with a combination of drugs for pulmonary tuberculosis develops a decrease in visual acuity and red-green color blindness resulting from retrobulbar neuritis. Which of the following agents is responsible for these findings?
If we say that here is no significant association between two variable and if truly an association exists. Then it is called:
A nucleophilic attack on deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) that causes the disruption of base pairing occurs as a result of the administration of
Stormy clot reaction is seen in
questions.explanation:
Option 1
  • C. perfringens ferment lactose with the production of acid in litmus milk. The color of the medium changes from blue to red.
  • Casein of the milk is coagulated by the production of acid and the coagulated milk is broken down by the production of a large volume of gas. Due to the release of gas, the paraffin plug is pushed up with shreds of broken clot adhering to the sides of the glass tube. This reaction is known as stormy fermentation, characteristic of C. perfringens.

questions.text: A 22-year-old female presents with the sudden onset of a high fever, a diffuse erythematous skin rash, and shock. She started menstruating at age 13 and for several years has used tampons. Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this individual’s illness?

questions.explanation:
Primordial prevention Prevention of emergence of development of risk factors Done by health education.
Primary prevention Action taken prior to the onset of disease Done by health promotion & specific protection.
Secondary prevention Action which halts the progress of a disease Done by early diagnosis & treatment
Tertiary prevention Action taken during the progression/ end of disease Done by diability limitation & rehabilitation.

A 60-year-old female is brought to the ER hypotensive (blood pressure 80/60) and confused. A preterm baby was brought to the OPD with a complaint of recurrent vomiting and blood in stools. Later diagnosis of Necrotising enterocolitis was made. X-Ray abdomen was done which is given below. What is the stage of NEC in this case ?
questions.explanation:
Stage 1

  • 1a : Occult blood in stools
  • 1b : Fresh blood in stools

Stage 2

  • 2a : Pneumatosis intestinalis
  • 2b : Posrtal vein gas shadows
  • Stage 3 : Metabolic acidosis, hyponatremia and thrombocytopenia is seen
  • 3a : Peritonitis
  • 3b : Pneumoperitoneum (intestinal perforation)

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the OPD with complaints of unilateral headaches with rhinorrhea and tearing of the eye on the side of the headache. options.text: Admit the patient and give prophylactic thrombolytic therapy

options.text: Admit the patient for observation with no change in medication

questions.correct_answer: B. Admit the patient and begin intravenous heparin

Her lab values are as follows: H ct: 47% (37–48) WBC: 11 (4.3–10.8) Plasma glucose: 160 mg/dL (75–115) Plasma calcium: 11 mg/dL (9–10.5) The most likely diagnosis is

questions.text: Which of the following is true of calcaneal fractures?

options.label: A
options.text: They are typically associated with an increased Bohler’s angle.

options.label: B
options.text: They are extra-articular in the majority of cases.

options.label: C
options.text: The Sanders classification is based upon the number and location of articular fragments on sagittal CT scan.

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral fractures occur in 5–10% of cases

questions.correct_answer: D. Bilateral fractures occur in 5–10% of cases

questions.text: A 37-year-old nurse was admitted to the hospital because of high fever to 102°F. A thorough workup was done in the hospital for over 3 weeks with no significant results. No etiology could be identified and she continues to have temperature spikes which go greater than 102°F too. The least likely diagnosis in this patient can be

A 10 years old girl presented with complaints of severe throat pain. On examination, the patient presents with features depicted below in this image. Which of the following is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Types of Acute Tonsillitis
Acute catarrhal/superficial Part of generalized pharyngitis (Viral infections). Tonsils appear red and congested
Acute follicular Infection spread into the crypts with purulent material presenting at the opening of crypts as yellow spots
Acute parenchymatous Tonsils are uniformly enlarged and congested
Acute membranous Exudates coalesce to form membrane on the surface of tonsil

questions.text: A 35 year old WoodWorker presents to the ER with a lacerated foot after he accidently lost control of his axe. The patient suffers severe hemorrhage and becomes hypotensive. The anesthetic was maintained with nitrous oxide and isoflurane. Isoflurane was discontinued and a small dose of midazolam is given for amnesia. Which of the following is the most appropriate muscle relaxant to administer at this time to avoid excessive hypotension?
Which of the following statements about craniopharyngiomas is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The primary mode of treatment is radiation therapy

options.label: C
options.text: Children with these tumors often develop signs and symptoms of acromegaly

options.label: D
options.text: The tumors may cause compression of the optic tracts and visual symptoms

questions.correct_answer: D. The tumors may cause compression of the optic tracts and visual symptoms

questions.text: All the following bones contribute to nasal septum, EXCEPT ?
questions.explanation:
NASAL SEPTUM CONSISTS OF 3 PARTS:
Columellar septum Formed of columella containing the medial crura of alar cartilages united together by fibrous tissue and covered on either side by skin.
Membranous septum Consists of double layer of skin only. Lies between the columella & caudal border of septal cartilage (No bony/cartilaginous support)
Septum proper Osteocartilaginous framework, covered with nasal mucous membrane.

questions.text: A 55 year old woman with an open tibia/fibula fracture of her left lower extremity underwent uneventful debridement and external fixation. Her initial postoperative course was uneventful. On postoperative day 4, she was noted to have mild swelling of her left ankle and a fever of 38.6°C. Her wounds were without signs of infection and there were no palpable cords. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's findings?

A 27 year old woman gardener is certain that the landlord's son is in love with her even though he has shown no such interest in her, and is engaged to be married to someone else. She has also started telling co workers about his plans to marry her and gets angry with anyone who tries to convince her about the contrary. The woman can be diagnosed with:
Which of the following is incorrect for neonatal physiological jaundice ?

options.label: A
options.text: It never occurs in first 24 hours

options.label: B
options.text: It can be conjugated or unconjugated

options.label: C
options.text: Icterus does not involves palms and soles

questions.correct_answer: B. It can be conjugated or unconjugated
questions.explanation:
PHYSIOLOGICAL JAUNDICE PATHOLOGICAL JAUNDICE
  • It never appears in first 24 hours of life
  • It is always unconjugated ; urine doesn’t stain diaper and no pale stools
  • Palms and soles are never stained yellow
  • Clinical jaundice never persist beyond 3 weeks
  • It may appear in first 24 hours of life
  • It can be conjugated or unconjugated
  • High colored urine and pale stools may be present
  • Palms and soles may be stained yellow
  • It may persist beyond 3 weeks

questions.text: A 6 month old male child was brought to the OPD by his mother, complaining that she can able to hear a sound during inspiration. And specifically it increases on crying & reduces in prone position. Diagnosis ?

A man presents to the emergency room with sudden abdominal pain and an expanding, pulsatile abdominal mass on examination. His vital signs are: heart rate, 130 beats/min; blood pressure, 70/20 mm Hg; respiration, 30/min; temperature, 36.0°C. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

An asthamatic female developed PPH during a normal vaginal delivery. Her vitals were: HR- 110/min BP : 90/60 mmHg Temperature : 37 degree c During the management of the patient which of the following should not be given ?

A 20-month-old girl is brought to the OPD by her mother. She tells you that the girl has not spoken her first clear word yet, she also seems not to understand what people say to her, and refuses to play with her 3-year- old brother. The mother also tells you that her daughter seems clumsy and has started to make odd repetitive movements with her hands. Upon further investigation, she had a normal head circumference at birth, at 6 months, and at 12 months, and had seemed to be developing normally. On physical examination, the rate of head growth has slowed. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation:
Rett’s disorder (Rett’s syndrome)
  • Almost exclusively seen in Females
  • Normal development till 5 months.
  • Deceleration of head circumference (Microcephaly).
  • Loss of acquired hand skills and speech (Pincer grasp may be absent).

questions.text: A 38-year-old female complains of fatigue, constipation, and weight gain. There is no prior history of neck surgery or radiation. On examination, her voice is hoarse and her skin is dry. Lab tests show Serum TSH is elevated and T4 is low. The most likely cause of these findings is

A 25-year-old male presents to the ER with complaints of fever and shortness of breath for the past 1 hour. There is no pleuritic chest pain or associated rigors and no sputum production.Upon further examination, A chest x-ray shows diffuse perihilar infiltrates. The patient started on erythromycin which seems to have worsened his condition. A silver methenamine stain shows cyst-like structures. Which of the following is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Oral antibiotic therapy is not the treatment of choice

options.label: B
options.text: Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole is the treatment of choice in the non allergic patient

options.label: D
options.text: Tetracycline is more effective than erythromycin

questions.correct_answer: B. Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole is the treatment of choice in the non allergic patient

questions.text: A 52-year-old, 60-kg woman is admitted to the hospital immediately after being involved in a house fire. She has approximately 50% total body surface area (TBSA) burns that are at least partial-thickness burns. She has not received any intravenous (IV) fluids up to this point. Which of the following is the most appropriate IV fluid and rate of administration that should initially be given to this patient?

A girl sustains a needle prick to the left index finger over the distal palmar surface. Initially, she notices little discomfort. However, 3 days after the injury she develops intense pain in the distal phalanx that wakes her up at night. Regarding this situation, which of the following is the most appropriate statement?

options.label: A
options.text: She has an acute paronychial infection

options.label: B
options.text: Drainage is accomplished via an incision over the most tender region

options.label: C
options.text: Late sequelae of this type of infection seldom involve the bone

options.label: D
options.text: Cultures of the finger will most likely produce a gram-negative rod

questions.correct_answer: B. Drainage is accomplished via an incision over the most tender region

questions.text: A 30-year-old patient presented to the Orthopaedic OPD with sharp, stabbing groin pain associated with turning, twisting, and squatting. He also complains of stiffness in his pelvic area which is most commonly associated with limping. He has a history of mild developmental dysplasia of the hip (DDH) as a child. Which of the following is the most likely radiographic finding?

A man sustained a left femur fracture after a steel beam fell on his legs and trapped him underneath for 2 hours. On admission, the patient received 2 units of packed red blood cells for hypotension and had significant blood loss from the femur fracture. On hospital day 2, the patient is noted to have frequent runs of ectopy with widened QRS complexes on the electrocardiogram monitor. His urine is dark red, but microscopic examination of the urine reveals no red blood cells. Which of the following events is most likely responsible for this patient's current findings?

options.label: A
options.text: Hemolysis secondary to the blood transfusion

options.label: B
options.text: Acute tubular necrosis secondary to hypovolemia

questions.text: A 32 year old multiparous women comes to the emergency at 31 weeks gestation with complaints of painless recurrent bleeding pv. On examination FHS was 135 bpm and fundal height corresponded to gestational age. Which of the following is a risk factor for this condition ?

A baby is delivered by assisted forceps delivery. After 24 hours the mother noted a swelling over the infant’s head which was not crossing the suture lines. Which of the following is correct regarding this ?

options.label: B
options.text: It will disappear in 48 to 72 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Due to edema in layers of scalp

questions.text: Band shaped keratopathy is an age-related deposition of calcium salts in ?
Wood lamp’s Examination is a diagnostic Test wherein the skin or the hair is examined under exposure to the Black light emitted by the Wood lamp. Identify the incorrect statement.

options.label: A
options.text: Made up of Nickel Oxide and silica with Ultraviolet light with a wavelength of 360 nm

options.label: B
options.text: Corynebacterium minutissimum shows Golden yellow fluorescence

options.label: C
options.text: Wood's lamp enhances epidermal pigmentation but not dermal pigmentation

options.label: D
options.text: Mycobacterium leprae displays Blue white colour

questions.correct_answer: B. Corynebacterium minutissimum shows Golden yellow fluorescence
questions.explanation:
Disease Color On Wood’s Lamp (360nm UV light used)
1 Erythrasma (Corynebacterium minutissimum) Coral red color
2 Tinea versicolor Golden yellow
3 Tinea capitis (Microsporum canis or M. audouini) Yellow fluorescence.
4 Trichophyton schoenleinii Pale green
5 Microsporum audouinii or M. canis Yellow fluorescence
6 Pseudomonas aeruginosa Pale blue/ Aquagreen
7 Tuberous sclerosis Ash-leaf-shaped spot
8 Porphyria cutanea tarda Pink to pink-orange
9 Leprosy Blue white
10 Hypopigmentation Pale white
11 Hyperpigmentation Purple brown
12 Depigmentation – Vitiligo Totally white
13 Albinism Bright white
14 Pigmented lesions of the epidermis such as freckles are accentuated under a Wood’s light
15 Lesions dermal pigment such as postinflammatory hyperpigmentation fades under a Wood’s light.

questions.text: A non-cyanotic 3 day old child has a systolic murmur along the left sternal border; the examination is otherwise normal. Chest x-ray and ECG are normal. These findings are most closely associated with which of the following congenital cardiac anomalies?

A female with 39 weeks of gestation was delivered at home by normal vaginal delivery 48 hours ago. She came to emergency with complete perineal tear which happened during delivery . when is the ideal time to repair this ?

A 80-year-old male complains of hip and back pain. He has also developed headaches, hearing loss, and tinnitus. On physical exam the skull appears enlarged, with prominent superficial veins. There is marked kyphosis, and the bones of the leg appear deformed. A skull x-ray shows sharply demarcated lucencies in the frontal, parietal, and occipital bones. X-rays of the hip show thickening of the pelvic brim. The most likely diagnosis is

A 25 year old woman complains of episodes of diarrhoea and rectal bleeding. Her father died of colorectal cancer at the age of 41. On further examination, a double contrast barium enema was performed which showed more than one hundred small polyps. They measured approximately 5mm in size and they were spread out throughout the colon. An upper GI endoscopy demonstrates multiple polypoid lesions in the stomach and the duodenum. What is your diagnosis?
Steroids can be given for management of all the folllowing ophthalmic condition, EXCEPT ?

A 65 year old man is brought to the ER in a Post-ictal state. He gives a history of pulsatile left sided tinnitus for the past 4 weeks. He also has a history of a left craniotomy for the resection of Meningioma 6 months ago. The chances of him developing a dural arteriovenous fistula may be present. Which one of the following investigations would be the most appropriate to confirm this?

A 65-year-old man with diabetes, on an oral hypoglycemic, presents to the ER with a right shoulder injury. His heart rate is irregular and the following ECG was obtained. The best immediate therapy would be?

28 year old primigravida with 32 weeks of gestation came to OPD with chief complaint of painless vaginal discharge. On per speculum examination you see clear fluid coming out of the external os. Her vitals are stable. What will you do next ?

options.label: C
options.text: Start induction of labour by Oxytoxin 20 IU in 500 ml N.S

questions.text: Following vessels can be ligated in case of intractable Epistaxis, except:

A 28-year-old man is brought to the emergency room after a motor vehicle accident. He is alert and hemodynamically stable with a right femur fracture. He is transferred to the OT to perform an emergency open reduction procedure for the same. Anesthesiologist induces a rapid sequence anesthesia with sodium thiopental, fentanyl, and succinylcholine. After 30 minutes the ventilation pressures begin to rise while the blood pressure begins to fall. Auscultation reveals decreased breath sounds on the right. A right thoracostomy tube is placed, relieving a tension pneumothorax. Which agent most likely contributed to the pneumothorax?

A 29 year old man was recovering from acute necrotizing pancreatitis, which required operative debridement. On postoperative day 8, he had a large, melenic stool. Blood studies showed a drop in hematocrit from 32% to 26%. A nasogastric tube was placed, which returned minimal “coffee ground” residue (guaiac-positive) with a pH of 4.5. Which of the following statements is true regarding this patient's condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Gastrointestinal protection should not routinely be instituted because of the side effects of mucosal-protective drugs

options.label: B
options.text: Emergent exploratory laparotomy is indicated to quickly identify the source of bleeding

options.label: C
options.text: Gastric ulcers are most likely present, necessitatin immediate treatment for Helicobacter pylori

options.label: D
options.text: Proton pump inhibition is an effective method for preventing this condition

questions.correct_answer: D. Proton pump inhibition is an effective method for preventing this condition

questions.text: Match the following diseases with the enzyme deficiency they are associated with : 1) Pompe’s disease a) Muscle phosphorylase 2) Von Gierke’s disease b) Acid maltase 3) Anderson’s disease c) Branching enzyme 4) McArdle’s disease d) Glucose 6 phosphate
questions.explanation:
TYPE DISEASE ENZYME DEFICIENCY
I Von Gierke’s disease Glucose 6 phosphate
III Cori’s disease Debranching enzyme
IV Anderson’s Disease Branching enzyme
VI Hers disease Hepatic phosphorylase

TYPE DISEASE ENZYME DEFICIENCY
II Pompe’s disease Acid maltase
V McArdle’s disease Muscle phosphorylase
VII Tarui’s disease Phosphofructokinase

questions.text: 42 years old female came to your OPD with a chief complaint of post coital bleeding. Examination revealed cervical lesion of 5 cm extending to upper part of vagina without parametrial involvement. What is the stage of the disease ?
questions.explanation:
STAGING OF CARCINOMA CERVIX

I → Limited to Cervix

IA → Microscopic Cancer

  • A1 → < 3 mm depth
  • A2 → 3-5 mm depth

IB → Clinical/ macroscopic

  • B1 → < 2 cm
  • B2 → 2 – 4 cm
  • B3 → ≥ 4 cm

IIA→ Upper Vagina Involved without parametrial involvement

  • II A1→ < 4 cm
  • II A2→ ≥ 4 cm

IIB → Parametrial involvement but not upto pelvic wall

IIIA → Lower 1/3rd vaginal involvement

IIIB → Parametrial involvement till the pelvic side wall [Hydronephrosis +](MC Stage of Ca cervix presentation in India → STAGE III B)

III → involvement of pelvic/para aortic lymph nodes

  • C1 → Pelvic lymphnodes involved Imaging
  • C2→ Para Aortic lymphnodes involved

IVA → Bladder & Bowel Involvement

IVB → Distant Metastasis

questions.text: Patient came to OPD with a chief complaint of amenorrhea of 8 weeks associated with pain and spotting p.v. Her UPT was positive , HCG = 3500 IU On Trans vaginal USG there was empty sac. Serial Beta HCG levels were done which showed decreasing trend. Which of the following is correct ?

52 years old female came to gynae OPD with a complaint of itching on vagina and also complains of dyspareunia. On examination the vagina was dry. Diagnosis of atrophic vaginitis was made. Which of the following is the treatment of choice for this ?

34 year old female married since 5 years had primary infertility, but now she has conceived. She came to emergency with abdominal pain , on USG you found ruptured ectopic pregnancy. Her BP was 106/80, Pulse was 104/min. What will be the management ?
All of the following are true about the furuncle of ear, Except ?

options.label: A
options.text: Localised to outer 2/3rd cartilaginous part of EAC

options.label: B
options.text: Recurrent furunculosis should be investigated for diabetes mellitus.

options.label: C
options.text: Staphylococcal infection of the hair follicle

questions.correct_answer: A. Localised to outer 2/3rd cartilaginous part of EAC

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman with gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) undergoes anesthetic induction for an anterior cruciate ligament repair. She is induced with propofol, lidocaine, and fentanyl. Succinylcholine is administered. The endotracheal tube (ETT) is placed with direct laryngoscopy to 20 cm at the teeth and the oxygen saturation is maintained at 100%. What is the most reliable indication of ETT placement in the trachea?

options.label: D
options.text: Absence of sound over the epigastrium with ventilation (E) SaO2 of 100% immediately after intubation

questions.correct_answer: A. Persistent ETCO2 measurement with ventilation

questions.text: A 3 year old child is brought to the ER with breathlessness on exertion. A chest radiograph reveals interstitial change at the lung bases suggestive of Interstitial Lung disease. But the clinical symptoms appear to be more severe than the apparent radiological changes and therefore a confirmed diagnosis is yet to be made. Which of the following would be the next appropriate investigation?

A 24 year old asthmatic man is coming to the OPD with a fever, cough and shortness of breath. A course of Antibiotics has not improved the symptoms. On further investigations, a positive skin test for Aspergillus fumigatus along with an elevated serum IgE is found. The patient is immunocompetent with no previous history of Sarcoidosis or Tuberculosis. Which of the following are the most likely HRCT findings?

A 35-year-old female presents to OPD with symptoms of cough, dyspnea, and lymphadenopathy. Physical exam shows cervical adenopathy and hepatomegaly. Her chest radiograph is shown below. What is the next step to make a diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Bronchoscopy and transbronchial lung biopsy

questions.text: After a right inguinal hernia repair, a man develops erythema over the incision. A wound infection is diagnosed and the patient is discharged home while on 10 days of ciprofloxacin. Three weeks later he returns with complaints of persistent watery diarrhea with a low-grade fever. His temperature is 101°F, his heart rate is 80 beats/min, and his blood pressure is 125/65 mm Hg. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: No treatment, because the cause is probably viral

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true about Paralysis of the Recurrent laryngeal nerve ?

options.label: A
options.text: More Common on the left side

options.label: C
options.text: Cord will be in the lateral position on deep inspiration

options.label: D
options.text: Speech therapy is the treatment of choice

questions.correct_answer: A. More Common on the left side

questions.text: Which nerve is most at risk in the injury in the given image?

A patient comes to the ER with difficulty in breathing and low-grade fever. Upon further questioning, he has had weight loss for the past 6 months and also has poor excursion on the right side of the chest with decreased fremitus, flatness to percussion, and decreased breath sounds all on the right side. The trachea seems to be deviated to the left. The most likely diagnosis is
A man complains of regurgitation of saliva and of ingested but undigested food. An esophagram reveals a “bird’s beak” deformity. Which of the following statements is true about this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Chest pain is common in the advanced stages of this disease

options.label: B
options.text: More patients are improved by forceful dilation than by surgical intervention

options.label: C
options.text: Manometry can be expected to show high resting pressures of the lower esophageal sphincter

options.label: D
options.text: Surgical treatment primarily consists of resection of the distal esophagus with reanastomosis to the stomach above the diaphragm

questions.correct_answer: C. Manometry can be expected to show high resting pressures of the lower esophageal sphincter

questions.text: Dieulafoy’s lesion of the stomach is characterized by

options.label: A
options.text: A large mucosal defect with underlying, friable vascular plexus

options.label: C
options.text: Massive bleeding that requires subtotal gastrectomy

questions.correct_answer: D. Location in the proximal stomach

questions.text: Which of the following maternal serum markers is not included in quadruple test for screening in 2nd trimester ?
A 30 year old obese diabetic mother, delivered a baby by normal vaginal delivery. The newborn will be at risk of developing all except ?
A 70 year old man is found to have an asymptomatic carotid bruit. The best initial diagnostic examination would be:

9 years old boy living in a slum was brought to the OPD by a NGO. He is very thin and underweight for his age. He was diagnosed with marasmus. Which of the following is not a feature of this condition ?
Which of the following statements is correct regarding wound healing and persistent local tissue hypoxia?

options.label: A
options.text: Fibroblasts are stimulated by low oxygen tension

options.label: B
options.text: High lactate levels inhibit macrophage production of angiogenesis factor

options.label: C
options.text: Low oxygen tension is the most common cause of poor wound healing

options.label: D
options.text: Collagen synthesis is stimulated by hypoxia

questions.correct_answer: C. Low oxygen tension is the most common cause of poor wound healing

questions.text: An antiglaucoma drug responsible for the adverse effect shown here is:

A 5 months old infant was brought the OPD by her mother with a complaint of bluish discolouration of lips and skin since 2 months of age. It worsens while the baby is crying or suckling. On aauscultation you heard ejection systolic murmur in pulmonary area. Chest X-ray revealed Boot shaped heart. Which of the following is not a key component of this disease ?

A 17 year old presents to the Emergency Department with his distraught parents. The adolescent is brought with his neck bent to one side with eyes rolled upwards and his tongue is hanging fully out of his mouth. The symptoms regressed after he was given a dose of IV Diphenhydramine. After this intervention, the boy is able to speak and he admits to having taken a few pills at a friend’s house. Which of the following drugs most likely must have caused the above scenario?

A 5 year old boy with congenital sensorineural hearing loss and various patches of depigmented lesions all over his body arrives at the OPD with white forelock. On further examination you notice Heterochromia iridis. What is the child suffering from?
Maximun numbers of oogonia are seen in ovaries during :

An elderly male is involved in a motor vehicle accident, where he was traveling at 90 km/hr. His blood pressure is 110/74 mm Hg, with a heart rate of 87 beats per minute. After thorough examination his only injuries include a nondisplaced right femur fracture with intact peripheral pulses and some minor abrasions. Which of the following would be appropriate to confirm the absence of a cervical spine injury in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A normal lateral neck film with no cervical tenderness or pain during examination

options.label: B
options.text: A normal anterior posterior film with no cervical tenderness or pain during examination

options.label: C
options.text: Physical examination alone with no cervical tenderness or pain during examination

options.label: D
options.text: Lateral, anterior-posterior, and odontoid views with no cervical tenderness or pain during examination

questions.correct_answer: D. Lateral, anterior-posterior, and odontoid views with no cervical tenderness or pain during examination

questions.text: Most common cause of frequent change in presbyopic glasses among the following are:

A woman presents to the ER complaining of redness and pain in her right foot up to the level of the midcalf. She reports that her right leg has been swollen for at least 15 years, but her left leg has been normal. On physical examination she has a temperature of 102.2°F. The left leg is normal. The right leg is not tender, but it is swollen from the inguinal ligament down and there is an obvious cellulitis of the right foot. The patient’s underlying condition is:

A primigravida with 34 weeks of gestation came to emergency with complaints of headache and blurring of vision since last 3-4 hours. On examination : BP is 160/110 mmHg, urine protein is 2+ , FHR is normal. What would you do next ?

A 13 year old male presents with complaints of gradual deterioration of vision. Brain magnetic resonance imaging showed a solid mass lesion involving the hypothalamus and the optic chiasm. The visual field defect in this case with optic chiasma compression by the mass is:

A 50-year-old alcoholic male is being treated for tuberculosis, but he has not been compliant with his medications. He complains of increasing weakness and fatigue.On examination, He appears to have lost weight, and his blood pressure is 80/50 mmHg. There is increased pigmentation over the elbows.In the advanced stage of this disease, the most likely electrolyte abnormalities will be

options.label: C
options.text: Low serum Na+ and high serum K+

questions.correct_answer: C. Low serum Na+ and high serum K+

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman has pain in her fingers from exposure to cold, pain in her knees, and difficulty swallowing solid food. Which is the most definitive test to make a profound diagnosis?

A 34-year-old woman has recurrent fainting spells induced by fasting. Her serum insulin levels during these episodes are markedly elevated. Correct statements regarding this patient’s condition include which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: The underlying lesion is probably an α-cell tumor of the pancreas

options.label: B
options.text: The underlying lesion is usually multifocal

options.label: C
options.text: She should be screened for a co-existent pheochromocytoma

options.label: D
options.text: Serum calcium levels may be elevated

questions.correct_answer: D. Serum calcium levels may be elevated

questions.text: Juvenile Angiofibroma is most commonly supplied by ?

During cardiac transplantation, a recipient requires multiple blood transfusions from blood loss during surgery. During the operation, the patient develops sudden hypotension, bleeding from intravenous sites and wound edges, along with severe tachycardia. Which of the following is the most likely cause of these findings?
Most important factor for development of diabetic retinopathy is
Which of the following is most important for onset of labour ?

A couple presented to the psychiatric OPD where the husband says he witnessed an episode of sleepwalking by his wife which she has no memory of. He also says she relocates belongings from their room to the hall or she will start tidying up the room. The following are parasomnia EXCEPT

A 45-year-old male complains of intense pain and tenderness over the right ankle. There is no history of trauma. The patient has hypertension and is taking a mild diuretic for the same. On examination, his ankle is swollen and tender.What is the next step in management?

options.label: B
options.text: Obtain uric acid level and perform arthrocentesis

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain uric acid level and perform arthrocentesis

options.label: D
options.text: Obtain ankle x-ray to rule out fracture

questions.correct_answer: B. Obtain uric acid level and perform arthrocentesis

questions.text: A 19 year old girl presents with an anterior neck mass. Her thyroid scan, shown below, is most consistent with which of the following disorders?

A 22 year old anxious woman who is on birth control pills presents to the emergency room with shortness of breath. The absence of which of the following would make the diagnosis of pulmonary embolism unlikely?

A 37 year old unemployed man comes to the OPD with itchiness, soreness, or a burning sensation in and around the affected areas of skin. The Extensor aspect of his skin also has silvery- whitish scales which upon scratching bleeds. Histopathology of the lesion is least likely to show which of the following?

options.label: D
options.text: Clubbing of rete ridges at the base

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding hypospadias is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: It is often associated with chordee

options.label: B
options.text: The most common location is penoscrotal

options.label: C
options.text: It is a rare fusion defect of the posterior male urethra

options.label: D
options.text: It occurs sporadically, without evidence of familial inheritance

questions.correct_answer: A. It is often associated with chordee

questions.text: All of the following can be associated with Keratoconus, EXCEPT ?
